description: A startup script to initialize, configure, and manage a MySQL database server, including checking if it's running, initializing data directory, starting the server, applying schema migrations, seeding data, and generating connection info.

methods.name: run_sql_file
methods.description: Executes a given SQL file using available connection methods, prioritizing using a connection info file, then socket, then TCP connection.

methods.name: apply_migrations
methods.description: Ensures the migrations tracking table exists, then applies new SQL migration files in order, avoiding reapplication of already applied migrations.

methods.name: apply_seed
methods.description: Seeds initial data into the database if not already present, checking for key records.
